clinical_study.brief_title: Motivational Interview Intervention to Help Patients Formulate Their Goals for Medical Care in the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Test the Acceptability and Feasibility of Brief Motivational Interview Intervention to Help Patients Formulate Their Goals for Medical Care in the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: Test the acceptability and feasibility of a brief motivational interview intervention to facilitate advance care planning (ACP) conversations for older adults with serious co-morbid illness being discharged from the emergency department (ED). The investigators will interview the participants to understand their perception of the intervention and collect patient-reported outcomes data after leaving the ED.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the intervention by patients.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the intervention in the emergency department.
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will qualitatively measure how patients perceived the intervention by conducting qualitative interviews and identifying recurrent themes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the intervention by administering clinicians.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the intervention in the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will ask the emergency department clinicians who administered the intervention to report the intervention acceptability using a Likert scale survey.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (in-person) and 3 months after (over the phone) the intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure patient's quality of life using a validated survey measure (Quality of life at the end of life, QUAL-E) at baseline and after the intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (in-person) and 3 months after (over the phone) the intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure patient's behaviors and actions for completing advance care planning using a validated survey measure (Advance care planning engagement survey) at baseline and after the intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (in-person) and 3 months after (over the phone) the intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure patient empowerment by using a validated survey measure (Patient Activation Measure, PAM™) at baseline and after the intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the intervention in the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure patient anxiety/distress by using a validated survey measure (Impact of Event Scale - Revised, IES-R) after the intervention.

arm_group.description: This is a single arm study with all enrolled patients receiving the same brief motivational interview intervention.

intervention.description: A brief (<7minutes) interview by an emergency department clinician to empower patients to formulate and communicate their goals for medical care with patients' outpatient clinicians.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥65 years of age
- English-speaking
- Capacity to consent
- AND ≥1 Serious illness (New York Heart Association stage 3 or 4 heart failure, oxygen-dependent chronic obstructive lung disease, chronic kidney disease on dialysis, and metastatic cancer.) OR determined by the emergency department provider that the patient has a high likelihood of death in the next 12 months ("I would not be surprised if this patient died in the next 12 months.").
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute physical or emotional distress
- Determined by emergency department provider not to be appropriate
- Clearly documented goals for medical care already exists (e.g. medical order for life sustaining treatment - MOLST).
- Already enrolled in this study
